p: In this study, all the extracts of C. edulis leaves were observed to exhibit low antiplasmodial activity in vitro (IC 50 of 50-100 μg/ml). This concurs with previous studies by [ 37]. Water and methanol extracts of S. africana were in this study observed to exhibit high in vitro antiplasmodial activity (IC 50 < 10 μg/ml). In in vivo experiments, aqueous extracts of this plant exhibited moderate activity (39.09%) while methanol extracts showed low activity (27.06%), thus confirming the use of this plant for treatment of malaria.
